intro: Cyphostemma flavicans, commonly known as the yellow cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange to red berries. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
